1.text: Trace the mason jar lid on a piece of felt.

2.text: Cut an ‘X’ shape in the felt for the tissues to come through.
2.vid: /2/29/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Glue the piece of felt into the mason jar lid.
3.vid: /b/bd/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Open the side of a box of tissues with the top of the box facing upwards.
4.vid: /a/a6/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 4.360p.mp4

5.text: Take a 0.5 in (1.3 cm) stack of tissues out of the box.

6.text: Fold the tissues in half crosswise so they’re standing vertically.
6.vid: /6/64/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 6.360p.mp4

7.text: Pull up the tissue on top so that it’s loose.
7.vid: /3/37/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 7.360p.mp4

8.text: Fold the tissues in half again lengthwise.
8.vid: /c/cd/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 8.360p.mp4

9.text: Place the tissues in the open jar with the loose tissue facing upwards.
9.vid: /d/da/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 9.360p.mp4

10.text: Pull the top tissue through the lid opening and screw the lid on.

11.text: Wipe the inside and outside of the empty jar with a damp paper towel.

12.text: Paint the empty jar with acrylic paint to update the color, if desired.
12.vid: /3/34/Roll Tissues for a Mason Jar Step 12.360p.mp4

13.text: Add extras like glitter or wording to make your jar unique if you'd like.

14.text: Put the tissues in the jar after the jar is dry.
